Author: Andy#1801
Content: Especially if we talk about small "helper dependencies" that have like 5 actual lines of code but 500 dev dependencies to run tests, minify etc.

Author: Andy#1801
Content: It would be nice to have like a "reputation system" where people can vouch for the code / changes in a specific repository. Because I assume there are 100s of devs using all those various crypto libraries. If we all worked together we could probably solve that problem, at least in our crypto-space. (Because we don't actually have that much code, it all boils down to some bitcoinjs and web3 libraries. But I might also be wrong here.)

Author: allbits#5898
Content: I'm having a blast learning cli wallet. But can't figure out how to claim rewards/interest?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just send all your funds to yourself

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: getbalance

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: send all but 0.0001 to yourself

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
```
$ ./komodo-cli sendtoaddress
error code: -1
error message:
sendtoaddress "KMD_address" amount ( "comment" "comment-to" subtractfeefromamount )

Send an amount to a given address. The amount is a real and is rounded to the nearest 0.00000001

Arguments:
1. "KMD_address"  (string, required) The KMD address to send to.
2. "amount"      (numeric, required) The amount in KMD to send. eg 0.1
3. "comment"     (string, optional) A comment used to store what the transaction is for.
                             This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.
4. "comment-to"  (string, optional) A comment to store the name of the person or organization
                             to which you're sending the transaction. This is not part of the
                             transaction, just kept in your wallet.
5. subtractfeefromamount  (boolean, optional, default=false) The fee will be deducted from the amount being sent.
                             The recipient will receive less KMD than you enter in the amount field.
```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @allbits use `sendtoaddress` and like james said, save 0.0001 for a txfee, or use the `subtractfeefromamount` flag

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: sending funds to yourself will cause your interest to be paid out via the "fee"

Author: allbits#5898
Content: Got it. Thanks

Author: allbits#5898
Content: ... aaand it worked ...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the getinfo command will display the accrued rewards

Author: allbits#5898
Content: cli so direct and responsive - love it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, i never understood why people demanded GUI wallet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all it does is issue cli calls for you

Author: allbits#5898
Content: Yes, I see the accrued interest in getinfo

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Only downside by using CLI is you need to backup the wallet.dat or make sure you send all funds back to the original address or some will go to change addresses. One way around that is to use a pubkey.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: `-pubkey` option to `komodod` solves most problems with wallet.dat and change addresses

Author: allbits#5898
Content: How do I use pubkey option?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: ./komodod -pubkey=02xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: ./komodo-cli validateaddress Rxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: gives the pubkey - starts wiyth 02 or 03
